visualization_prompt: Generate a line chart showing monthly metric progression using categorical time labels and SVG annotation overlays
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains 12 monthly observations of a single performance metric. Categorical x-axis labels represent months, while continuous y-values show indexed measurements. Original data exhibits seasonal patterns with summer peaks and year-end decline, preserved in the synthetic recreation through intentional trend design. The line chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating unnecessary gridlines while maintaining critical reference elements. Color choices follow Cairo's principles of perceptual contrast, using blue for primary data and red/green for annotations. Annotations use z-index layering to maintain visual hierarchy. Synthetic data maintains μ=125.4, σ=56.2 to simulate real-world variance, with intentional Q2-Q3 elevation (+38% from baseline) modeling operational seasonality.
